snippet: Renzo Piano’s Nasher museum in Dallas is suffering from excessive glare shining off a new condo tower the museum’s fame helped attract to the area.
abstract: Nasher Sculpture Center in Dallas, designed by Renzo Piano, is suffering from excessive glare shining off a new condo tower the museum’s fame helped attract to the area; glass skin of the condo tower now reflects so much light that it is threatening artworks in the galleries, burning the plants in the center’s garden and blinding visitors; dispute over what to do raises the broader question of what can happen when, as is currently the rage, cultural institutions are cast as engines of economic development.
lead_paragraph: Renzo Piano’s Nasher museum in Dallas is suffering from excessive glare shining off a new condo tower the museum’s fame helped attract to the area.

headline.seo: Renzo Piano’s Nasher Museum in Dallas Has Sunburn Problem
headline.main: Dallas Museum Simmers in a Neighbor’s Glare
headline.print_headline: Dallas Museum Simmers in a Neighbor’s Glare
